plan: Define the overall architecture: Decide on the structure of the software, including the modules, classes, and functions needed.
Design the user interface: Determine how the user will interact with the software, such as through a command-line interface or a graphical user interface.
Implement core functionality: Write the code for the main features of the software, using appropriate algorithms and data structures.
Test and debug: Thoroughly test the software to identify and fix any bugs or errors.
Integrate components: Combine the different modules and components of the software to ensure they work together seamlessly.
Document the software: Create documentation that explains how to use the software and how it works internally.
Deploy the software: Make the software available to users, either by installing it on their computers or by deploying it to a server.
